info: This is a generic powertrain diagnostic trouble code (DTC) and applies to many OBD-II vehicles (1996-newer). That may include but is not limited to vehicles from Ford, GMC, Chevy, Dodge, Ram, etc. Although generic, the exact repair steps may vary depending on year, make, model and powertrain configuration.
OBD-II trouble code P254A and related codes P254B, P254C, P254D and P254E are associated with the PTO or power take off speed selector sensor/switch 1 circuit.

The PTO or power take-off is a system that is linked to the transmission of the vehicle and is used to drive auxiliary equipment. That auxiliary equipment might include things such as snow plows, dump beds, etc.

When the PCM detects improper voltage or resistance within the PTO speed selector sensor/switch 1 circuit, code P254A will be set and the check engine light, service engine soon light or both may be illuminated.
symptoms:
Auxiliary PTO equipment will not function
Check engine light illuminated
causes:
Defective PTO sensor
Open or short in PTO sense circuit
Faulty or damaged wiring
Corroded, damaged or loose connector
Defective fuse or fuse-able link (if applicable)
Defective PCM
